title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The Patriots might cut Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million despite his strong 2025 performance and relationship with QB Drake Maye.
DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte could be released to save $3-$4 million each; Boutte is a potential trade piece.
Christian Elliss and Garrett Bradbury are candidates for release, potentially saving the team several million in cap space for 2026.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in the Celtics' game vs. 76ers as he continues recovering from a right Achilles injury.
Joel Embiid will miss the game with an oblique strain; he is expected to miss three more games.
The Celtics have won eight of their last ten games and currently rank second in the East standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran has hit three home runs in the first week of Red Sox spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
Duran's improved performance against lefties follows a challenging 2025 season where he hit just .211 in lefty matchups.
Originally expected to take a reduced role, Duran's strong spring showing could alter his position in the Red Sox lineup.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau lead Boston College with 39 combined goals this season, boosting Bruins' prospects.
Boston Bruins' rebuilding efforts ahead of schedule with multiple prospects excelling in 2025-26 college hockey season.
Bruins' prospect pool strengthened by players like Letourneau and Hagens, ready to bring talent to the NHL soon.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are 5.5 games behind the Pistons in the Eastern Conference standings as of February 2026.
An unnamed Western Conference assistant coach calls the Celtics the favorite to win the East, even without Jayson Tatum.
Boston has strong offensive stats with Jaylen Brown averaging 29.1 points, compared to Detroit's reliance on Cade Cunningham.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The band's setlist included a mix of Isbell's solo work, tracks with the 400 Unit, and covers by Drive-By Truckers.
Isbell's performance showcased a blend of Americana, rock, and country, highlighting both new hits and deeper cuts.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers like Maxx Crosby or Trey Hendrickson due to high market prices.
New England has $40 million in cap space but may prioritize the NFL Draft to strengthen pass rush.
Missouri's Zion Young, favorite for Patriots in draft, had 6.5 sacks and 52 pressures last season.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance is set to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS, owned by Paramount and Warner Bros. Discovery respectively, may integrate following the acquisition.
Netflix may pursue CBS's NFL rights after losing a bidding war for Warner Bros. Discovery to Paramount.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots show interest in A.J. Brown but find Eagles' asking price too high, per reports.
Eagles face potential $44 million in dead money if they trade Brown before June 1.
Brown, under contract through 2029, had 1,003 yards in 2025 but faces possible trade this offseason.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts E-ZPass transitions from transponders to RFID windshield stickers starting Sunday, reducing costs significantly.
The new sticker tags, costing 55 cents each, will save the state an estimated $7.4 million yearly.
Existing transponder users can keep them; free sticker replacements available, previously costing $20.
